trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with AnswerHub | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with AnswerHub | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use AnswerHub with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use AnswerHub with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and AnswerHub.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and AnswerHub.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: An AnswerHub single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: An AnswerHub single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to AnswerHub will be able to single sign into the application at your AnswerHub company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to AnswerHub will be able to single sign into the application at your AnswerHub company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for AnswerHub
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for AnswerHub

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for AnswerHub.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for AnswerHub.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type AnswerHub.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type AnswerHub.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select AnswerHub, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select AnswerHub, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>AnswerHub</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>AnswerHub</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to AnswerHub with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to AnswerHub with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the AnswerHub application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the AnswerHub application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to AnswerHub page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to AnswerHub page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the AnswerHub Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://company.answerhub.com", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the AnswerHub Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://company.answerhub.com", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at AnswerHub page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at AnswerHub page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your AnswerHub company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your AnswerHub company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Administration.
trans-unit.target: Go to Administration.

trans-unit.source: Click the User and Group tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the User and Group tab.

trans-unit.source: In the navigation pane on the left side, in the Social Settings section, click SAML Setup.
trans-unit.target: In the navigation pane on the left side, in the Social Settings section, click SAML Setup.

trans-unit.source: Click IDP Config tab.
trans-unit.target: Click IDP Config tab.

trans-unit.source: On the IDP Config tab, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the IDP Config tab, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAML Setup</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAML Setup</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at AnswerHub dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the IDP Login URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at AnswerHub dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the IDP Login URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at AnswerHub dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the IDP Logout URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at AnswerHub dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the IDP Logout URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at AnswerHub dialog page, copy the Name Identifier Format value, and then paste it into the IDP Name Identifier Format textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at AnswerHub dialog page, copy the Name Identifier Format value, and then paste it into the IDP Name Identifier Format textbox.

trans-unit.source: Click Keys and Certificates.
trans-unit.target: Click Keys and Certificates.

trans-unit.source: On the Keys and Certificates tab, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Keys and Certificates tab, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Keys and Certificates</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Keys and Certificates</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the IDP Public Key (x509 Format) textbox.
trans-unit.target: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the IDP Public Key (x509 Format) textbox.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: On the IDP Config tab, click Save.
trans-unit.target: On the IDP Config tab, click Save.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into AnswerHub, they must be provisioned into AnswerHub.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into AnswerHub, they must be provisioned into AnswerHub.

trans-unit.source: In the case of AnswerHub, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of AnswerHub, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your AnswerHub company site as administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your AnswerHub company site as administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Administration.
trans-unit.target: Go to Administration.

trans-unit.source: Click the Users & Groups tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the Users & Groups tab.

trans-unit.source: In the navigation pane on the left side, in the Manage Users section, click Create or import users.
trans-unit.target: In the navigation pane on the left side, in the Manage Users section, click Create or import users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Users & Groups</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Users & Groups</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Type the Email address, Username and Password of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision into the related textboxes, and then click Save.
trans-unit.target: Type the Email address, Username and Password of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision into the related textboxes, and then click Save.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other AnswerHub user account creation tools or APIs provided by AnswerHub to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other AnswerHub user account creation tools or APIs provided by AnswerHub to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the AnswerHub **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the AnswerHub **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
